caption: This was a highlight of our trip to Paris and we had looked forward to this for a year. A very enthusiastic tour guide. Only French was spoken but if travelling in August you can have an English tour. To ride on 3 merry-go-rounds, all of which were quite old, was an experience. Book your tickets in advance. Highly recommended.

Amazing tour from Manu, thank you so much! You should book in advance. We were lucky that they signed us up for a tour in English the next morning and the tour guide is a real comedienne and actress. Without her story this would be just a bunch of carousels. I especially appreciate the possibility to ride and play which gets you in the fairground vibe, this was really well thought through.

This is a very mysterious museum. You need to make an appointment to enter. The audience can have fun while visiting, and the tour guide is also very professional and enthusiastic. This is my first time to visit such a museum. I think it is very novel and interesting. I highly recommend it to everyone.‚ù§Ô∏è

It's among my top places in Paris because it provides a distinctive insight into the history of fairground attractions, where you can even play or ride some of them. I visited the museum during the Christmas season, which was incredibly special with multiple events and mini shows organized for the occasion.

OMG, this delightful place melted my heart! My inner child was running madly all over the place, although outwardly I remained relatively calm. What a fun, unusual, and fascinating place, full of unique history of the Belle √âpoque/Gilded Age. Some items on display were over 100 years old and still in working order. We rode on different Merry-go-Rounds, played a horse derby game reminiscent of corn hole, and watched gorgeously dressed automatons perform. The icing on the cake was our guide, Liber, who easily was the most entertaining and enchanting of the three I saw there. Even though the ticket said the tour was French only, he graciously went back and forth from French to English to make sure everyone understood. He was like a big child himself, so enthusiastic about sharing this special place with us, bursting into song and constantly making jokes. It definitely was the highlight of my trip! Make sure you request Liber as your guide, and make your reservation early!
Wonderful place for a visit and a big positive surprise. We have tried old games from last century and get in touch with that reality .
This has to be the coolest venue for a group dinner I've ever seen.  The cocktail hour consisted of medieval games and entertainment and the dinner was fantastic!

This place is a marvel. Really enjoyed seeing all the cool things. They do a great job letting you ride and play. I don't speak French but could tell how fun and entertaining the guide was for the kids. Loved it.
Magical. Mysterious. Charming. Easily one of the most interesting museums in Paris.

MAGICAL place in Paris where you are transported to a fairground of fantasies and a time when your eyes were open to wonder!  The tours are in French üá´üá∑ but the guides are charming, include you, and delight you!  A booking is a must - you can‚Äôt just walk in!  I felt like I walked into a Baz Luhrmann movie set.  The carousel üé† rides make me feel like a kid again!
A must visit. Visitors are invited to join the attractions. Great for children. Good guide. You need to book in advance. I don't speak much french. The guide was easy to follow.
Very interesting antique carnival museum. Rides, games, very cool. Very large inside with many rooms. Good for functions.

This was our favorite thing in Paris! Never mind that you don't speak French! You don't need to understand the tour to enjoy it! It's overwhelmingly beautiful! And they let you ride the rides! It's fun for adults and children and I wouldn't miss this for the world! It's a little out of the way, but it's a beautiful neighborhood and we recommend hopping on eBikes to get there because it's a lovely ride from the city center along the river for a long way. So much nicer than the metro! Seriously, if you're on the fence about whether it's worth it or not, It is!!!

The space is magical‚Äîtruly beautiful. You feel transported to another world during your visit. Our guide, Liber, was simply amazing. It's clear he loves the place and enjoys sharing all the details about it. He's super funny and kind, ensuring you have an outstanding experience. This is a fantastic experience and well worth the cost.

Best museum in Paris! The tour was in French but our wonderful tour guide translated everything into English for me, which I truly appreciated! We enjoyed the interactive experience in the museum, it lasted for 2 hours. It will be great if the visitors can have 3-5 minutes of free time in every room, so we can have time to appreciate the set up and take some pictures.

One of the best museum experiences I‚Äôve ever had. My wife, daughter and eight year old grandson were part of an afternoon tour led by Max. The tour is in French but they offer some very helpful printed information in English. Max also lived/worked in NYC for several years and was really cool about making sure we were enjoying ourselves. It did help that our daughter is French-fluent and our grandson attends a French-American school in the states. YET, one could go on this tour without the French and be totally swept away in the magic of it all. It was like walking into the Willy Wonka Chocolate Factory with Willy Wonka (Max) himself!! The machines and automatons are simply amazing and beautifully well kept and ‚Ä¶ WORKING! I can‚Äôt say enough about this ‚Äúmuseum.‚Äù It‚Äôs totally worth the effort to make the trip outside the downtown area to it. RSVPS are recommended.

Absolutely beautiful & stunning little treasure of Paris! The tour guides were absolutely amazing! We did not speak French but that didn‚Äôt matter as the whole building is beautiful, he had us up dancing and laughing and playing with the antique games! Not a place to be missed!
Really nice and informative tour, the guide was fantastic and very funny. Suitable for adults and children, I went as an adult and I sure had fun! Gorgeous decorative historical pieces. Thank you!!

This was absolutely amazing!  Our favourite part of our trip to Paris, and this was our first time.  The guide was really funny and engaging, spoke perfect English, which was a huge bonus as we were a little embarrassed to not speak enough French to fully understand what was going on.  I don't want to spoil any of the tour, but I would 100% recommend visiting!

This museum is the most interesting one I have been in Paris!!  There are a lot of big toys and some circus props in the place. And the tour guide is very vivid, although all the process in the guide use French, but I still could understand a little by the lively guideüòÜ!!!  By the way, the environment in the garden is very well, if you go to Paris, must visit this museum, you will get more out of your imagination

It‚Äôs a fun place but it‚Äôs only French tour and we can‚Äôt really understand it 90% of the time except for the game playing part. So it‚Äôs a bit dull and boring to me. It would have been much more fun if it‚Äôs in English. If you only want to experience the environment and the games then it‚Äôs good to go otherwise if you higher expectations to know more then not really recommended

We visited in the offseason. BEST MUSEUM VISIT we have been on to date. Engaging, interesting, and fund. If you had children with you while visiting Paris, this is the place for all of you to enjoy. Libert was the guide who lead the tour in French but filled us English speakers in whenever we needed.  5 stars
This place is umbelievable. If you want to feel 16. Century fun and how that looks and feels like, this is the right place. Amazing ‚ù§Ô∏è

This place is amazing! I was expecting kind of a museum with interesting facts and items from Fairground but not at all!  The museum is filled with games, shows and interactivity. We spent so much time with my friends trying all activities. Those activities are really affordable, fun, and even when it seems like to have a long queue, it goes pretty fast!  Finally, the space is beautiful and it is incredible to find it in the middle of Paris. Shout out to all staff members who do an amazing job at entertaining visitors! I loved it!  May be try to go there during morning to have a less crowded place!

A magical place, very interesting to visit with children. I was impressed by the musicians' show. We also enjoyed the sets where you can take pictures. There was a human-powered carousel, lots of fun. There are some interesting vintage fair games that you can see as museum exhibits. The program was in French, but that wasn't a problem at all. Very beautiful and unique interior. In short, an unique place to visit.
Eclectic mix of fairground memorabilia, some interactive.

If you like fairground, circus and carnival rides, as well as circus wood carvings, games, mechanical music players, this is the place for you. We were on a French tour consisting of about 20 people. There was no English translations available for the commentary. So, be aware of that. Our only complaint was that it lasted about 90 minutes and should have been no more than an hour. Kids seem to love it.
Very interesting museum, great experience and also a lot of joy, competent and funny lady guide.

If you manage to get tickets over the Christmas period you get to explore on your own if French language tours are an issue. While this means it means it is a little busier in places, you do have the freedom to roam and enjoy the festive spirit and amazing old machines!

This is one of the coolest things I have ever done in Paris. My mind was totally blown by the setting, collection, and experience of the tour. Nathalie was the most amazing guide. Her passion for the museum shined through and made it so fun. I had no idea we would get to ride the rides and play the games, which made it all that much more magical. Definitely reserve this tour.
Loved the experience. What an interactive guide tour! We took several carousels and play couple games. They were all amazing! I would definitely recommend to others who has time to visit them.

Wow! This was absolutely fabulous! Bigger and better than I'd anticipated, full of quirky beautiful treasures. My teenagers were completely won over too.  The tour was in French mainly (we knew this) but there is an English leaflet and our most excellent guide also did a quick English recap. Lots of fun still to be had.  It was also a huge relief to be away from crowds and heat in these cool spacious rooms. That was an added bonus...

This was an incredible experience, my friend had thought it was just a museum tour, but it was something far more spectacular.  The host is incredibly talented and transformed what we thought was going to be a walk around a museum to an immersive phantasmagoric experience.  We see some of the only English speakers there and the only adults lol, but he made sure we were included and gave us one of the best moments on our trip to Paris.  I highly recommend this

By far the best experience Paris had to offer. Such a wonderful and eclectic collection presented in a way that transports you to a magical otherworld. I've been here twice and I will go again. The tours are french speaking...but it really doesn't matter if anything it feels more authentic this way. Can't recommend more. Truly a must and like nothing else.

Visited this place during a conference for an after party. The venue had a very unique atmosphere that was fantastic! The variety and quality of food was excellent, the games and entertainment were enjoyable and the service staff were kind, fun, and helpful. Overall, the evening was a very memorable experience! We were a very large group of eventually over 200 people and the venue accommodated us all nicely. I can highly recommend this place.

I went here for the christmas special theme, which is held without guided tour. I think in the rest of the year, it is only possible by tour. There were a lot of kids, but it is just as fun as for the adults. Some attractions are inside, but you have to have a attraction ticket(not the entry ticket) to ride it. Also a lot to see, some shows to see and lot of fun toys. I spent 2 hours inside the museum. Recommended.

What an amazing experience with our tour guide, Lib√®re! We got some really interesting history about this wonderful place - and the best part was playing some of the games, riding some rides, dancing, singing along with Lib√®re, and being in awe of all the historic wonders the museum has to behold! This was an absolute highlight for our Paris experience and is not one to miss!!

What an experience! On our second time in Paris we looked for something intersting/a bit different to do, and when we discovered Les Pavillons de Bercy we were not disappointed. You MUST book onto a tour, and unfortunately the tours are given in French only, however this did not take away from our experience in the slightest. We were given a leaflet which had some information in English, and used google translate to help with the information given throughout the tour.  Our guide, Max, was so knowledgeable and passionate about the exhibits and we had so much fun because of him!!! If you go here you must embrace the eclectic nature of the museum and not take yourself too seriously, it's amazing. There are many more photos I could attach, but then you wouldn't need to go and see it for yourself üòâ
